org.zaproxy.zap.extension.httpsessions

Class HttpSessionsSite

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.zaproxy.zap.extension.httpsessions.HttpSessionsSite

  • public class HttpSessionsSite
extends Object
    The Class SiteHttpSessions stores all the information regarding the sessions for a particular Site.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      HttpSessionsSite(ExtensionHttpSessions extension, String site)
      Instantiates a new site http sessions object.

      • createEmptySession

        public void createEmptySession(String name)
        Creates an empty session with the given name.

        The newly created session is set as the active session.

        Note: If a session with the given name already exists no action is taken.

        Parameters:
        name - the name of the session
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the name is null or an empty string
        See Also:
        setActiveSession(HttpSession)

      • createEmptySession

        public void createEmptySession()
        Creates a new empty session.

        The newly created session is set as the active session.

        See Also:
        setActiveSession(HttpSession)

      • getHttpSessions

        protected Set<HttpSession> getHttpSessions()
        Gets an unmodifiable set of the http sessions. Attempts to modify the returned set, whether direct or via its iterator, result in an UnsupportedOperationException.
        Returns:
        the http sessions

      • getHttpSession

        protected HttpSession getHttpSession(String name)
        Gets the http session with a particular name, if any, or null otherwise.
        Parameters:
        name - the name
        Returns:
        the http session with a given name, or null, if no such session exists

      • renameHttpSession

        public boolean renameHttpSession(String oldName,
                        String newName)
        Renames a http session, making sure the new name is unique for the site.
        Parameters:
        oldName - the old name
        newName - the new name
        Returns:
        true, if successful
